folder: 114th Street and Pleasant Avenue, Manhattan, N.Y.
text:
(1)
Feast of Our Lady of Mt. Carmel; 1924; No. 19: Photographers, standing on 114th Street near Pleasant Avenue, Jefferson
Park in the background.
July 16, 1924.
P. L. Sperr.

(2)
No. 20. Lemonade vender, Pleasant Avenue, east side, between
114th and 115th Streets.
July 16, 1924.
P. L. Sperr.

(3)
No. 21. A fortune teller with a parrot and two trained white
mice, location uncertain.
July 16, 1924.
P. L. Sperr.
title: Feast of Our Lady of Mount Carmel.

folder: 114th Street and Pleasant Avenue  , Manhattan, N.Y.
text:
(1)
Feast of Our Lady of Mt. Carmel: Vendors of clams, with pushcart set up in Jefferson Park, at 114th Street and Pleasant Avenue. In the background is seen part of the Standard Gas Light plant which in a few years is to be demolished.
July 16, 1926.

P. L. Sperr.

(2)
Vendors of sacred pictures, rosaries, and other religious trinkets, on Pleasant Avenue; the view is north from 114th Street.
July 16, 1926.

P. L. Sperr.

(3)
Votive images, dolls and candles on sale, shop near Jefferson Park.
July 16, 1926.

P. L. Sperr.
title: Feast of Our Lady of Mount Carmel.

folder: 114th Street and Pleasant Avenue, Manhattan, N.Y.
text:
(1)

Feast of Our Lady of Mt. Carmel: Meat being broiled over charcoal, at a stand on 114th Street opposite the N.W. corner of Pleasant Avenue.
Part of the Standard Gas Light plant, which in a few years will be demolished, is shown in the background.

July 16, 1929

P.L. Sperr

(2)

Later in the day this watermelon stand was set up on the N.W. corner of Pleasant Avenue and 114th Street.  This is the same corner which is shown in the above view.

July 16, 1929

P.L. Sperr
title: Feast of Our Lady of Mount Carmel.

folder: 114th Street (East) & Pleasant Avenue, Manhattan, NY
text:
East 114th Street, north side, between Pleasant Ave., and the Harlem River, as seen from across Jefferson Park (foreground) northward. These buildings will be demolished.

November 9, 1934.

P. L. Sperr.

folder: Pleasant Avenue & 114th Street (East), Manhattan, NY
text:
Pleasant Ave., east side, north from and including East 114th to and including 115th Streets. This, the Standard Gas Light Co. Plant, will be complete/demolished.

September 12, 1934.

P. L. Sperr.

folder: Pleasant Avenue & 114th Street (East), Manhattan, NY
text:
(1)
A rear view of Pleasant Ave., east side, from, but not including East 114th to and including 115th Streets. The view shows a portion of the site of the Standard Gas Light Co., Plant, during demolition. Gas tanks shown, are on the S.E. corner of East 115th Street.

September 12, 1934.

P. L. Sperr,

(2)
The same, from a different angle. Notice the spire of the Church of Our Lady of Mt. Carmel, (on East 115th Street, west of Pleasant Ave), through the structural frame of gas tanks.

November 9, 1934.

P. L. Sperr.

folder: Pleasant Avenue & 114th Street (East), Manhattan, NY
text:
(1)
A rear view of Pleasant Ave., east side, from, but not including East 114th to and including 115th Streets. The view shows a portion of the site of the Standard Gas Light Co., Plant, during demolition. Gas tanks shown, are on the S.E. corner of East 115th Street.

November 9, 1934.

P. L. Sperr.

folder: Pleasant Avenue & 114th Street (East), Manhattan, NY
text:
Pleasant Ave., west side, north from, but not including East 114th Street, as seen across on the N.E. corner of East 114th Street.

September 17, 1935.

P. L. Sperr.

folder: Pleasant Avenue & 114th Street, Manhattan, NY
text:
(1)

Pleasant Avenue, west side, from 114th to 115th Streets, seen from 115th Street near the Harlem River; the view is west on 115th Street. In consequence of the demolition of the Standard Gas Light Company's plant and tanks on either side of 115th Street, it is possible to see a little of Jefferson Park and a few houses on First Avenue, south of 114th Street, shown at the left, also the rear of the buildings on the east side of Pleasant Avenue north of 115th Street, shown at the right.

July 19, 1935.

P. L. Sperr.

(2)

Pleasant Avenue, west side, from 114th to 115th Streets, a close view, not showing the full corner of 115th Street. Pleasant Avenue is part of Avenue A, as originally surveyed. It extends from 107th to 124th Streets, and has been known under its present name since the 1870's. Jefferson Park was laid out around 1900, breaking Pleasant Avenue between 111th and 114th Streets.

July 19, 1935.

P. L. Sperr.

folder: Pleasant Avenue & 114th Street, Manhattan, NY
text:

Pleasant Avenue, west side, from 114th to 115th Streets, seen from 115th Street near the Harlem River; the view is west on 115th Street. July 19, 1935.

P. L. Sperr.

(2)

Pleasant Avenue, west side, from 114th to 115th Streets, a close view, not showing the full corner of 115th Street. Pleasant Avenue is part of Avenue A, as originally surveyed. It extends from 107th to 124th Streets, and has been known under its present name since the 1870's. Jefferson Park was laid out around 1900, breaking Pleasant Avenue between 111th and 114th Streets.

July 19, 1935.

P. L. Sperr.

folder: Pleasant Avenue & 114th Street (East), Manhattan, NY
text:
Pleasant Ave., east side, north from, but not including East 114th to and including 116th Streets. Clearance in the foreground, was formerly the site of the Standard Gas Light Co., Plant.

July 19, 1935.

P. L. Sperr.

The same, showing a further view northward.

March 8, 1936.

P. L. Sperr.

folder: 114th Street and Pleasant Avenue, Manhattan, N.Y.
text:
(1)
Feast of Our Lady of Mt. Carmel: Pretzels for sale by two enterprising youngsters at the eastern end of 114th Street, east
of Pleasant Avenue.
The sign in the background applies to the ferris wheel, which
is not shown in this view.
July 16, 1935.

P. L. Sperr.

(2)
Another pretzel vendor, at the S.E. corner of Pleasant Avenue and 114th Street. The view is east. Notice the ferris wheel, operated by the American Legion, in the background.
July 16, 1935.

P. L. Sperr.

(3)
Pretzels, on the S.E. corner of First Avenue and 114th Street.
The view is roughly northwest.
July 16, 1935.

P. L. Sperr.
title: Feast of Our Lady of Mount Carmel.

folder: 114th Street and Pleasant Avenue  , Manhattan, N.Y.
text:

Feast of Our Lady of Mt. Carmel: Heavy watermelon consumption, 114th Street at Pleasant Avenue. Jefferson Park is in the background.

July 16, 1935.

P. L. Sperr.

(2)
More of the same, 114th Street at Pleasant Avenue; the view is north.

July 16, 1935.

(3)
The same, in Jefferson Park at the S.E. corner of First Avenue and 114th Street.

July 16, 1935.

folder: 114th Street (East) and Pleasant Avenue, Manhattan, N.Y.
text:
(1)
Feast of Our Lady of Mt. Carmel, No. 7: Stands and amusement erected for the Feast of Our Lady of Mt. Carmel on East 114th Street, at Pleasant Ave. On the right appears a portion of Jefferson Park.

July 16, 1937.

P. L. Sperr.

(2)
No. 8:
The same as the preceding view. Note the Triborough Bridge on
Wards Island, in the background.

July 16, 1937.

P. L. Sperr.

(3)
No. 9:
The same street at First Ave.

July 16, 1937.

P. L. Sperr.

folder: Pleasant Avenue & 114th Street (East), Manhattan, NY
text:
Pleasant Avenue, east side, between East 114th and 116th Streets, showing the new site for the Benjamin Franklin High School under preparation. This $3,500,000 structure is to seat 3285 students. It will be erected in the form of a double E and front onto the East River Drive. A fuller account of the various details and an architects sketch will be found in the New York Times of November 22, 1939.

Individually the photographer gives the locations as, northward from the new East River Drive and 114th Street in No. 1; a demolition at Pleasant Avenue and 115th Street in No. 2; and another demolition at the S. E. corner of 116th Street and the Avenue, in No. 3.

July 16, 1939
Views 1,2,3

P. L. Sperr
